intro: Austrocylindropuntia pachypus, commonly known as the Pachypecten cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of South America. It is characterized by its thick, cylindrical stems that are ribbed and covered in spines. The plant produces large, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are reduced to spines, and it stores water in its stems to survive in dry conditions. This cactus is adapted to harsh environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
